intro: Calyptranthes speciosa, commonly known as the showy calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. Its flowers, which bloom in clusters, are usually pink or white and attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Calyptranthes speciosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils.
